title: Radiation Safety Protocols
userMessage: What are the safety protocols for pregnant staff working with radiation?
assistantMessage: According to Yale Radiology policies, pregnant staff should follow these guidelines: 1. Report pregnancy to Radiation Safety Officer 2. Wear dosimeter at waist level under lead apron 3. Limit fluoroscopy procedures when possible

title: Equipment Maintenance
userMessage: How often should MRI machines be calibrated?
assistantMessage: Yale Radiology policy requires MRI machines to be calibrated quarterly by certified technicians, with additional checks following any software updates or physical adjustments to the equipment.

title: Patient Privacy Policies
userMessage: What are the policies regarding sharing patient images for research?
assistantMessage: For research purposes, all patient images must be properly de-identified according to HIPAA guidelines. Written consent must be obtained specifically for research use, and the IRB approval is required before any images can be shared.
